content.raw:
So it looks like on systems where users can’t read each other’s files, you could have the secret file owned by one user and not readable by others - which is how ssh secrets are generally stored in home directories on linux for example. So there is some benefit.  
I can switch it pretty easily to being passed in as an environment variable that will be visible to only the process in question. I’ll change it to do that for both local and remote processes for the shared secret. In fact, these command line arguments are pretty unwieldy - maybe we should just pass in the entire zprocess parentinfo dict as an environment variable.
